fields.headline: Pop preview
fields.bodyText: The Ting Tings, Brighton The very model of a frothy pop single, That's Not My Name, the first release by Manchester's the Ting Tings, suggested that here was a British group doing something generally not common in this country. Rowdy, catchy and halfway between Toni Basil and Girls Aloud, the single suggested that here was a band making the kind of pop perhaps thought to be exclusively made abroad by the likes of CSS. It's something that Jules De Martino and Katie White may struggle to match up to. From a background in a Salford arts commune, the pair occasionally show a bizarre leaning towards Fame Academy-style vocals - though they strive to keep things featherweight and fun. · Komedia, Brighton, Thu 15; Concorde 2, Brighton, Fri 16
